intro: Cedronella japonica, commonly known as Japanese cedronella, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. It is valued for its aromatic foliage and has been used in traditional herbal medicine. Cedronella japonica is also cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its delicate appearance and fragrance.
